choices.D: Another assignment rule is giving ownership to the administrator.
choices.C: The Owner field is missing on the webform and email template.
choices.A: An escalation rule is changing the case owner on case creation.
choices.B: The Assignment Rule checkbox is selected by default.

questions.question_text:
The administrator at Cloud Kicks writes an assignment rule to send all cases created via email or the web to the Automated Cases Queue. Any manually created cases should be owned by the agent creating them; however, the manually created cases now show the administrator as the owner.
What will the administrator find when troubleshooting this issue?

choices.A: Filter by a single shipment record type in the list view.
choices.B: Split views are only available on standard objects.
choices.D: Add the Manage List Views permission for support users.
choices.C: Include the Shipments tab on the app's navigation bar.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
correct it should be C
Also custom object can be included

questions.question_text:
The Support team at Ursa Major Solar prefers using split list views on the case homepage. Occasionally, the team views shipments from another support application.
What should the administrator configure to allow the team to use the split list view?

choices.B: Create one page layout. Use business processes to ensure the proper status picklist values display.
choices.D: Create one page layout. Use record types to ensure the proper status picklist values display.
choices.C: Create two page layouts. Use business processes and record types to display the appropriate picklist values.
choices.A: Create two page layouts, one with a House Status field and the other with a Condominium Status field.

questions.question_text:
DreamHouse Realty regularly holds open houses for the selling of both houses and condominiums. For condominium open houses, there are a few extra steps that need to be taken. Agents need to be able to submit requests and receive approvals from the homeowners' association.
How can the administrator ensure these extra steps only appear when creating open house records for condominiums?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I think it's answer C.

questions.question_text:
DreamHouse Realty (DR) develops town center projects all over the country and would like to use Salesforce to track this development. DR needs to track the full properties and the buildings on each property.
How should the administrator relate the two objects to each other?

choices.A: Create a junction relationship between the building and property.
choices.D: Create a master-detail relationship from the building to property.
choices.B: Create a hierarchical relationship from the building to property.
choices.C: Create a lookup relationship from the building to the property.

discussion.content: A & C should be most correct

questions.question_text:
An administrator at Cloud Kicks wants to deactivate a user who has left the company.
What are two reasons that would prevent a user from being deactivated? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The user is the sole recipient of a workflow email alert.
choices.D: The user is the highest role in the role hierarchy.
choices.C: The user is part of a territory hierarchy.
choices.A: The user is in a custom hierarchy field.
